question: the programs that run on a computer are referred to as hardware.
humans can perform computations as fast as modern computers can.
Information in a secondary storage unit is retained when the computer is turned off because secondary storage units are volatile.
Output units make information processed inside the computer available for use outside the computer.
The ARPANET was a predecessor to the Internet.
Today's set of Internet protocols, a set of rules for how computers communicate with each other, is called HTML.
Interpreter programs execute high-level language programs without compiling them into machine language first.
A computer can directly understand a high-level language.
C was initially used as the development language of the UNIX operating system.
C++ programmers can use a C-like programming style, an object-oriented programming style or both.
Java was originally intended for use in intelligent consumer-electronic devices.
The phenomenal success of the World Wide Web contributed to the interest in Java.
The Ada programming language was named after Lady Ada Lovelace, designer of the Analytical Engine mechanical computing device.
COBOL is still used to program a considerable portion of today's entertainment software.
Visual Basic .NET, is object oriented and provides reusable components that programmers can use to develop applications.
The Framework Class Library is only used for Visual C++.
Procedural programming languages focus on actions rather than objects.
Objects have attributes and perform actions.
.cpp, .h and .exe files store C++ statements.
The process of converting statements from a high-level language into statements of a machine language is known as compilation.
To execute an application in a Windows command prompt, you must specify the name of the application followed by the .exe extension.
The cd command changes directories.
